name: EmailSenderService
description: A small NodeJS app allows users to send emails to anyone without logging in,
Use the hand-rolled HTTP requests instead of integrated APIs from Email Services.

name: Pacman
description: Pacman game built by 2 different platforms: C++ and Javascript
Even I finished Javascript version first, which took about 2 days,
C++ was always challenging when I needed a week to implement >.<,
and I will remember it as the first time I carefully documented my project.

name: Besmart
description: An update of previous Besmart, which I added Material Design and SIP functions
Using for clubs, bars where the need of notification and communication is a must

name: AromaPlayer2.0
description: Second version of AromaPlayer, built from the scratch with WPF
With the help of my team, it is in testing stage after a half year of development.

name: AromaPlayer
description: AromaPlayer is a video player which can interact with AromaShooters
It allows you to add and enjoy aromas of your favorite videos.
C++ was always challenging when I needed a week to implement >.<,
It took me 1 year to plan, code, test and release.

name: SuperfastDictionary
description: My first published app as the result of 1 week fighting with Android Studio
User interface is minimalized to get an incredible speed of loading data.
Attracted 25k downloads with 500 daily active users.

name: AfterAll
description: Currently in beta, this app saves your important dates, countdown and get noti.
Syncing between devices using Google Calendar API.

name: FreeCodeCamp
description: I have finished Front End Development Certification from FreeCodeCamp
which is worth 500 hours of learning and coding, with many challenges and projects.

name: Naruto
description: My final assessment of Intro to Web class at AIT, with the score of 96%.

name: Hachi
description: Assessment for Java class at HUST.
Management Software for Libraries which can keep track of staffs, members and books.
With a good UI and necessary functions, It can be applied right away in any libraries.

name: EngVnDictionary
description: First project in the first term of HUST, it was a dictionary in Linux.
Even with the limit of knowledge about coding, we had to search and read a lot
thanks to the effort of all members, we did make an incredible application.
